episodes.title: Why Did The Met Police Fail To Act For Over 15 Years?
episodes.description:
In this snippet from our complete interview; historian and author Andrew Lownie lays out the case for a full, independent investigation into why the Metropolitan Police repeatedly refused to pursue a criminal inquiry into Prince Andrew’s links to Jeffrey Epstein.

We examine the Met’s shifting explanations, the gaps in their public statements, and the unanswered questions that continue to undermine confidence in the UK’s justice system. Why did the police rely on a “review” rather than a formal investigation? What evidence was dismissed without scrutiny? And what role, if any, did institutional pressures or deference to the monarchy play in shaping the outcome?

This conversation goes beyond the headlines. It asks what accountability looks like in a system where power, privilege, and policing intersect — and why transparency is essential if the public is ever to trust the process.

If you value clear, evidence‑based analysis on royal scandals, institutional failures, and the machinery of reputation, this is an interview you won’t want to miss.

episodes.title: Andrew Lownie on Secrets, Silence, and the Machinery of a Royal Cover‑Up
episodes.description:
In this in‑depth conversation, historian and biographer Andrew Lownie joins The Vintage Read Show to unpack the royal cover‑ups, hidden files, and institutional secrecy that have shaped the modern monarchy. This is a long‑form, forensic discussion that goes far beyond headlines!

Andrew Lownie's Substack - The Lownie Report
https://andrewlownie.substack.com/?utm_source=global-search

episodes.title: Monitored - Andrew Lownie
episodes.description:
What a delight to have Andrew Lownie visit The Vintage Read Show! In this episode, he tells a chilling tale of censorship, suppression & lies. 
The best-selling author of Stalin's Englishmen, The Mountbattens & Traitor King, has also been a bookseller, publisher, and journalist, writing for the Times, Telegraph, Wall Street Journal, Spectator, and Guardian. Since 1988, he has run his own literary agency, specialising in history and biography.

episodes.title: FBI Files & Frolics - Andrew Lownie
episodes.description: The Mountbattens received the full "Lownie" treatment in his 2019 publication! "The Mountbattens, Their Lives and Loves" Based on over 100 interviews, research from dozens of archives and new information released under Freedom of Information requests, Andrew answers all the questions I had deep diving into this, at times, dark tale. We discuss all the rumours swirling about Lord Louis Mountbatten's private life and look behind the man, the myth, and the legend as depicted in the wartime film In Which We Serve. A searingly honest and brave biography.
